intro: Taeniophyllum torricellense, commonly known as the Torricella moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a small, terrestrial plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has a thalloid structure, with a leafy, green stem covered in small, overlapping leaves. Its reproductive structures, including male and female gametophytes, are located on the same plant, facilitating sexual reproduction. Taeniophyllum torricellense plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various invertebrates.
